item.title: Sterling's Rise May be Limited as High Inflation Could Upset Policy Credibility
item.description: MUFG Bank said the BOE will inevitably raise interest rates again in June and potentially in August after the inflation data, but sterling’s gains may be limited, as high inflation could upset policy credibility.

item.title: Oil Gains as API Figures Point to Inventory Drawdown
item.description: Oil posted more solid gains in Europe after the latest API data showed U.S. crude stocks fell again, while comments from Saudi Arabia’s energy minister, interpreted as an implicit threat the cartel might cut production, added support to prices.

item.title: Gold Edges Higher, Supported by Possible Safe-Haven Demand
item.description: Base metals were mixed in early London trade and gold was flat, as investors awaited the release of the latest Fed meeting minutes, with Goldman Sachs saying it expects short-term price weakness for industrial metals due to the weakness in western economies.

item.title: Gilt Yields Jump as UK Inflation Beats Forecasts; Eurozone Bond Yields Rise
item.description: Gilt yields jumped while eurozone government bond yields also rose after U.K. inflation data for April came in higher than expected.

item.title: Marks & Spencer Profit Rises; to Pay Dividend
item.description: Marks & Spencer said it plans to reintroduce a modest dividend at the time of its half-year results in November, as it reported a rise in pretax profit for the year to £476 million, despite inflationary cost headwinds hitting margins.

item.title: UK Inflation Falls Less Than Expected
item.description: UPDATED: U.K. consumer prices increased 8.7% in April, kept elevated by rising food prices, and the core rate unexpectedly rose, suggesting the Bank of England may need to raise interest rates again.

item.title: Kingfisher Keeps Profit Target Despite Sales Fall
item.description: Kingfisher said its first-quarter comparable sales fell 3.3%, as poor weather in the U.K. and France hurt its performance, but it remained comfortable with its full-year profit forecasts.

item.title: Aviva Posts Solid First Quarter; Backs Targets
item.description: Aviva’s general insurance gross written premiums hit £2.4 billion in the first quarter on an 11% rise in sales, and it said it was on track to meet or exceed some financial targets by 2024.

item.title: Nikkei Falls 0.9% on Worry U.S. Debt-Ceiling Talks Could Stall
item.description: Japan’s Nikkei closed 0.9% lower as worries that stalling U.S. debt talks could lead to a technical default or create a situation that does huge damage to the U.S. fiscal credibility, CMC Markets said.

item.title: Lenovo Profit Slumps Amid Continued PC Weakness
item.description: Lenovo Group’s fourth-quarter net profit fell 72%, as personal-computer sales continued to decline amid a deteriorating global economy and soft consumer spending.

item.title: RBNZ Signals Possible End to Interest Rate Hikes
item.description: The Reserve Bank of New Zealand raised its official cash rate by a further 25 basis points, but indicated it could be done tightening the policy screws as consumers have slowed spending.

item.title: Bank Stocks Are Now Meme Stocks
item.description: Shares of banks such as PacWest used to be too boring for active traders. That was before March.

item.title: Wagner Chief's Feud With Russian Military Cracks Putin's Image of Control
item.description: Prigozhin’s public criticism of Moscow’s generals and defense minister reveals strains in the mighty leadership structure the Russian president built.

item.title: The Luxury Shopping Oasis Emerging in San Francisco's Struggling Downtown
item.description: Foot traffic is down 27% in the historic shopping district amid concerns about crime and homelessness. But tourists are visiting high-end stores.

item.title: Share Buybacks Continue at Torrid Pace While Investors Sit on Sidelines
item.description: U.S. companies have announced $600 billion of share repurchases so far this year.

item.title: That $6,000 Vacation Isn't Worth It Right Now
item.description: Vacationers scratching their travel itch this season are sending prices through the roof. Here’s how some are making trade-offs.

item.title: Choice Hotels is seeking to buy Wyndham, according to people familiar with the matter, a deal that would create one of the biggest budget hotel owners in the country.
item.description: Choice Hotels is seeking to buy Wyndham, according to people familiar with the matter, a deal that would create one of the biggest budget hotel owners in the country.

item.title: The FTC is investigating whether manufacturers of baby formula colluded on bids for lucrative state contracts, according to documents posted on the agency's website.
item.description: The FTC is investigating whether manufacturers of baby formula colluded on bids for lucrative state contracts, according to documents posted on the agency’s website.

item.title: Major U.S. stock indexes ended lower as investors kept watch on debt-ceiling talks, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow losing 1.1%, 1.3% and 0.7%, respectively.
item.description: Major U.S. stock indexes ended lower as investors kept watch on debt-ceiling talks, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow losing 1.1%, 1.3% and 0.7%, respectively.

item.title: Traders worried about a potential U.S. default are swapping their go-to haven---Treasury bills that will mature over the next several months---for the bonds of America's top-rated companies.
item.description: Traders worried about a potential U.S. default are swapping their go-to haven—Treasury bills that will mature over the next several months—for the bonds of America’s top-rated companies.
